step1.sentence: She forgot her umbrella and caught a cold after walking home in the rain.

step2.story: Tom went out without a jacket on a chilly evening and caught a cold by the next morning. He spent the whole day in bed with a box of tissues and hot soup, regretting his choice.

step3.story: It had been a long week at work, and Maya was exhausted when Friday finally came. She decided to take a shortcut home through the park, even though the wind was bitter and she had left her scarf behind. By Saturday morning, her throat was sore and her nose was running — she had caught a cold. She wrapped herself in a blanket, made a cup of ginger tea, and cancelled all her weekend plans. As she rested on the couch, she promised herself she would dress more warmly the next time the temperature dropped.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: '감기를 잡다'라는 표현으로, 감기 바이러스에 감염되어 아프게 됨을 뜻합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실생활에서 '감기에 걸리다'를 나타낼 때 가장 자연스럽게 쓰이는 표현입니다. 'get a cold'와 함께 일상 대화에서 자주 사용됩니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'catch'는 원래 무언가를 '붙잡다'는 뜻이며, 병을 외부에서 받아들이는 개념으로 확장되어 'catch a cold(감기를 얻다)'처럼 쓰이게 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 주로 추위, 비, 또는 타인과의 접촉 등 외부 요인으로 인해 감기에 걸렸을 때 사용하며, 다소 우연적이고 방어하지 못한 뉘앙스가 담겨 있습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Make sure you wear a coat outside or you'll catch a cold.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 밖에 나갈 때 코트를 입어야 해, 안 그러면 감기에 걸릴 거야.
